text: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.
author: Victor Hugo

text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Science is not a boy’s game, it’s not a girl’s game. It’s everyone’s game.
author: Nichelle Nichols

text: There are opportunities even in the most difficult moments.
author: Wangari Maathai

text: Don’t be afraid of hard work. Nothing worthwhile comes easily.
author: Gertrude Belle Elion

text: It is not our differences that divide us. It is our inability to recognize, accept, and celebrate those differences.
author: Audre Lorde

text: The most important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Fear is just a term for obstacles that are yet to be overcome.
author: Bessie Coleman

text: If I can create a legacy that inspires others to achieve the impossible, then I have done my duty.
author: Bessie Coleman

text: I want to make it possible for others.
author: Bessie Coleman

text: Never be limited by other people's limited imaginations.
author: Mae Jemison

text: Science is the search for truth — it is not a game in which one tries to beat his opponent, to do harm to others.
author: Linus Pauling

text: We must believe in the power and strength of our words. Our words can change the world.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: The joy of discovery is certainly the liveliest that the mind of man can ever feel.
author: Claude Bernard

text: Believe in the power of your dreams and have the courage to pursue them.
author: Kalpana Chawla

text: Science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated.
author: Rosalind Franklin

text: The future influences the present just as much as the past.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
